content:
• Monday, May 21, 2018
  • SHOP

    Shopify -2.4% after Adobe announces deal for rival Magento

    • Shopify (NYSE:SHOP) falls by as much as 5.5% following Adobe Systems’ (NASDAQ:ADBE) agreement to buy commerce platform company Magento for $1.68B; SHOP now -2.4% after-hours.
    • SHOP competes against Magento in providing software to build and run web stores and process online orders.
    • Through today’s close, SHOP shares were up 43% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 39 Comments
  • NDSN

    Nordson -5% despite strong Q2 after weak guidance

    • Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN) -5.4% after-hours as it reports better than expected FQ2 earnings and in-line revenues but guides Q3 revenues below consensus.
    • NDSN sees Q3 GAAP EPS of $1.47-$1.63, which may not be comparable to $1.91 analyst consensus estimate, with sales forecast in the range of +1% to -3% compared to the year-ago quarter, which would equate to $571M-$595M vs. $620M consensus.
    • Backlog for the quarter ended April 30 was ~$460M, up 11% Y/Y, including 10% organic growth and 1% growth due to acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 1 Comment

    Micron +2.9% on $10B share repurchase program

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) announces a $10B share repurchase program.
    • The program was announced in conjunction with plans to return at least 50% of FCF to investors beginning in FY19. 
    • Micron shares are up 2.9% aftermarket.

  • ARDX

    Ardelyx readies stock offering; shares down 8% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap Ardelyx (NASDAQ:ARDX) slips 8% after hours on light volume in response to its planned $50M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Separately, it inked a $50M senior secured bridge loan facility with Solar Capital Alliance Bank that was fully funded on May 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • FGEN

    FibroGen's pamrevlumab shows treatment effect in mid-stage IPF study; shares up 2% after hours

    • FibroGen (NASDAQ:FGEN) is up 2% after hours on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2b clinical trial, PRAISE, evaluating pamrevlumab in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). The data were presented at the American Thoracic Society Conference in San Diego.
    • At week 24, the change from baseline in quantitative lung fibrosis (QLF) volume in the treatment group was 24.8 mL compared to 86.4 mL for placebo (p=0.0090) (the lower number indicates less fibrosis). At week 48, the QLF change from baseline was 75.4 mL in the pamrevlumab group versus 151.5 mL for placebo (p=0.038).
    • Phase 3-stage pamrevlumab is a fully human monoclonal antibody that binds to (inhibits) the activity of connective tissue growth factor (CTGF), a protein that plays a key role in the progression of fibrosis (scarring) and related diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage -6.6% on Q1 beats with product margin drop, in-line guide

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG) drops 6.6% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 40% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q2 guidance has revenue of $296M to $304M (consensus: $299.43M). Non-GAAP gross margin expected from 63.5% to 66.5% and operating margin from -7% to -3%.
    • In-line FY19 guidance has revenue from $1.32B to $1.37B (consensus: $1.34B). Non-GAAP gross margin expected from 63.5% to 66.5% and operating margin from 0% to 4%. 
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 66.3% (-0.1 pts Y/Y); product gross margin, 66.3% (-1.3 pts); support subscription gross margin, 66.3% (+4.2 pts); operating margin, -6% (+7.9 pts); operating cash flow, $18.6M; FCF (ex-ESPP impact), $8.6M; customer add, 300 (total: 4.8K). 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Pure Storage beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (May 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 8 Comments
  • MYOK

    MyoKardia launches stock offering; shares down 3% after hours

    • MyoKardia (NASDAQ:MYOK) commences a public offering of 3.75M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 562.5K shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 3% after hours.

  • ADBE

    Adobe acquires commerce platform company for $1.6B

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE) will acquire commerce platform company Magento Commerce for $1.68B.
    • Magento’s platform combines digital commerce, order management, and predictive intelligence across shopping experiences. Current Magento clients include Canon, Paul Smith, and Rosetta Stone.
    • The Magento Commerce Cloud product will join the Adobe Experience Cloud.
    • The deal is expected to close in Adobe’s Q3 and each company will continue to operate independently after the close.
    • Adobe shares are up 1.2% aftermarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • GE

    GE sheds part of day's gain after Gasparino tweets about further dividend cut

    • General Electric (GE +1.8%) slips to its lowest levels of the day - although shares are still in the green - after Fox Business's Charles Gasparino tweets about a potential dividend cut at the company.
    • "GE insiders say further dividend cut or elimination possible as CEO Flannery scrambles to reduce costs," Gasparino tweets, adding that Flannery is coming up on his one-year anniversary as CEO still short of his goal of cutting $20B in costs despite today's Wabtec transportation deal.
    • Earlier: GE jumps to three-month highs as analysts praise Wabtec deal (May 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 83 Comments
  • TM

    Toyota preps for ix4 roll-out in China

    • Toyota (TM +0.2%) plans to start selling the ix4 compact crossover in China by the end of the year.
    • The company is using the nameplate of Chinese partner GAC Motors on the model to help it meet EV selling requirements in China.
    • Other GAC models are starting to stack up well in global markets, according to automobile industry experts.
    • GAC Motors is a 50-50 joint venture between Guangzhou Automobile Group's (OTCPK:GNZUF) GAC Group and Toyota.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM

    • Triple-net: Spirit Realty Capital (SRC +2.2%)
    • Healthcare: Sabra Healthcare (SBRA +2.4%)

    • Industrial: Lexington Realty Trust (LXP +1.8%)
    • Office: Government Properties Income (GOV-OLD +1.9%)

  • SESN

    Sesen Bio's lead ADC shows treatment effect in late-stage bladder cancer study

    • In what appears to be "selling on the news," Sesen Bio (SESN -21.3%) is down on almost a 20% bump in volume despite its announcement positive results from the Phase 3 VISTA study assessing lead antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) Vicinium in patients with high-grade non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC). Shares had more than tripled since March.
    • At month 3, evaluable patients with carcinoma in situ (CIS) (cancer is confined to the inner lining of the bladder) experienced a complete response rate of 39% (n=28/72). In patients with CIS with or without papillary disease (cancer has spread into the bladder but not to other tissues), the response rate was 80% (n=4/5).
    • The response rate was 42% (n=32/77) in a pooled group from the above patients based on FDA guidance on BCG-resistant CIS NMIBC patients (recurrent CIS within 12 months of BCG (bacillus Calmette-Guérin) therapy, the current standard of care).
    • In patients with papillary disease without CIS, treatment with Vicinium produced a 68% recurrence-free rate at month 3 (these patients underwent mandatory surgery before treatment).
    • On the safety front, 72% of adverse events (AEs) were mild or moderate. 4% were serious or life-threatening. These included acute kidney injury or renal failure and cholestatic hepatitis.
    • Vicinium is a recombinant fusion protein designed to specifically target and deliver an anti-cancer payload directly to cancer cells. The company says it is a next-generation ADC by virtue of its targeting of EpCAM antigens on the surface of tumor cells.
    • Management will host a conference call at 4:05 pm ET to discuss the results.
    • Previously: Eleven Bio up 22% on bullish expectations for late-stage Vicinium data (April 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 27 Comments
  • MCHP

    Microchip Tech commences senior note offering

  • MU

  • GE

    GE jumps to three-month highs as analysts praise Wabtec deal

    • Analysts are applauding General Electric's (GE +2.7%) deal to merge its transportation business with Wabtec (WAB +3.9%) in which GE will get $2.9B in cash and  50.1% ownership of the combined company.
    • "This deal is the largest cornerstone for John Flannery's plan to divest non-core assets," William Blair analyst Nick Heymann tells CNBC. "If this stock starts to move higher, people will worry about missing the upside."
    • "GE is no longer a contrarian stock. It's a value stock," Heymann says, rating GE at Outperform; while he does not have an official price target, he thinks shares can rise to $20-$22 in the next 12 months if the company generates $10B of annual free cash flow or $1.15 of free cash flow per share.
    • "The removal of this capital-intensive and secularly challenged business is still a net positive overall for GE's portfolio transformation," RBC Capital's Deane Dray writes, adding that "the $2.9B cash infusion helps give GE some welcomed cushion for its liquidity needs."
    • “Both business units have been impacted by the extreme cyclicality and uneven order flow of the locomotive business, and both units are likely to see improved demand in the next two years coming off a trough in demand in 2017,” says CFRA's Jim Corridore, who continues to rate GE a Hold.
    • Wells Fargo's Allison Poliniak-Cusic likes the deal for WAB, "with GE's locomotive positioning coupled with its increasing focus on digital and analytics being additive to Wabtec's portfolio."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 18 Comments

  • DE

    Deere shares getting ahead of themselves, Melius analyst says

    • Deere (DE +2%) enjoys strong gains following China's agreement to buy "massive" amounts of agricultural equipment - although no specifics have been provided - and have jumped 8% since it reported quarterly results last Friday, but Melius Research thinks DE shares may have gotten ahead of themselves.
    • Melius's Rob Wertheimer warns the bull case for agriculture, and by extension DE, relies on "record levels of equipment inefficiency and excess machinery continuing to worsen... we can’t see a way to be as sanguine as consensus."
    • But Wertheimer says farming practices are changing to use less power per acre prepped and planted, as GPS and guidance systems make horsepower more productive.
    • The analyst does not see a way to justify DE's big gap with Caterpillar, especially given catalysts at the latter, thus he reiterates a Neutral rating on DE and $164 price target; the firm rates CAT as a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 2 Comments

    Dover Downs tracks back after monster sports betting rally

  • CELG

    Celgene business development chief out last month

    • John Carroll reports that Celgene's (CELG -4.3%) business development head George Golumbeski quietly ended his nine-year stint at the biotech last month. His departure, mutually amicable according to Mr. Golumbeski, was the latest in a management shakeup led by new CEO Mark Alles. Former COO Scott Smith left a few days prior.
    • Mr. Golumbeski played a leading role a series of major acquisitions, including the $9B Juno buyout. Several acquired candidates have been failures, though, such as IBD drug mongersen and MS med ozanimod.
    • Celgene has shed almost half its value since the mongersen flop in October 2017.
    • For what it's worth, RBC says the continued weakness in the stock is unfounded considering Mr. Golumbeski was nearing the end of his career at the company and had already transitioned to a strategic role.
    • Previously: Celgene hits bump in road with IBD candidate GED-0301, two studies terminated; shares poised for down move after hours (Oct. 19, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 60 Comments

  • INO

    Inovio launches mid-stage study of VGX-3100 in anal precancer

    • Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO -3%) commences a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating lead candidate VGX-3100 in adults men and women with human papillomavirus (HPV)-related anal dysplasia (the presence of abnormal cells that could develop into anal cancer).
    • The open-label study will enroll ~24 subjects who will receive at least three doses of VGX-3100. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is August 2020.
    • Anal cancer kills 1,100 Americans each year. The current standard of care for anal dysplasia is surgical excision, electrocautery or laser therapy. The post-treatment recurrence rate is greater than 50%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 7 Comments
  • WWE

    WWE +4.7% on report of 'massive' Fox offer for 'SmackDown'

    • World Wrestling Entertainment (NYSE:WWE) has jumped 4.7% after receiving a "massive" offer to make Fox (FOX, FOXA) the new home of SmackDown Live, ESPN reports.
    • Specific terms weren't known but the deal is set to begin in October 2019.
    • That news comes after NBCUniversal (NASDAQ:CMCSA) declined first refusal on SmackDown, choosing instead to focus on Monday Night Raw.
    • SmackDown Live has averaged 2.59M viewers/week this year, while Raw has averaged about 3M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 22 Comments

    China's 21Vianet to two-month high on volume

    • China's 21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET) is up 11.6% on heavy volume in a delayed move after Thursday's earnings report.
    • Shares are at their highest point since March 23. They're now down just 16% YTD.
    • On Thursday, the company reported EBITDA nearly doubled to 196M yuan, with EBITDA margin jumping to 24.5% from the prior year's 11.6%.

  • FTNW

    FTE Networks up 5% post Q1 results

    • FTE Networks (FTNW +5%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 89.1% Y/Y to $85.1M.
    • Q1 overall margins: Gross declined 700 bps to 15.2% & Adj. EBITDA increased 626 bps to 8.7%.
    • Operating expenses were $11.3M (+22.8% Y/Y), the increase in expenses was due to higher stock compensation expense & increased amortization expense of intangible assets.
    • The company announced new infrastructure & technology expansion projects valued at ~$161M YTD.
    • Also, entered into agreement with a global tier-1 commercial real estate owner to provide CrossLayer service for their in-building technology & technology solutions.
    • Achieved a combined backlog of ~$460.7M (+6.2% Y/Y).
    • Cash & equivalents of $9.6M & working capital of $12.5M.
    • 2018 Outlook: Net revenue of $350M; Adj. EBITDA of $30M; Operating Income of $15M & Buildings on-net, 30.
    • Previously: FTE Networks reports Q1 results (May 21)

  • FCSC

    Fibrocell's gene therapy FCX-007 shows positive effect in RDEB study; shares up 4%

    • Preliminary data from a Phase 1/2 study evaluating Fibrocell Science's (FCSC +3.7%) gene therapy, FCX-007, in patients with recessive dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (RDEB) showed a treatment effect. The data were presented at the International Investigative Dermatology Conference in Washington, D.C.
    • Four patients with a total of seven wounds that were open for up to eight months prior to treatment were dosed with FCX-007 in the margins and across wounds in addition to intact skin sites.
    • At week 4, 100% (n=7/7) of wounds healed at least 50% compared to only one untreated wound (n=1/7). The treatment effect was durable, with 86% and 67%, respectively, of wounds maintaining the response at weeks 12 and 25/32.
    • Enrollment of six patients in the Phase 2 portion should be completed next quarter.
    • The company is developing FCX-007 in collaboration with Intrexon's Precigen unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 6 Comments

  • Italian bonds routed

    • The supposedly bullish news of a power-sharing agreement between Italy's Five Star Movement and The League isn't doing much to help that country's market for government debt, and chatter about a eurozone break up is again entering the conversation.
    • Italy's 10-year government bond has exploded higher by 18 basis points today to 2.40%. Against Germany, it looks even worse, as 10-year Bund yields are down six basis points.
    • Italian stocks are the worst performers on the Continent as well, with the FTSE MIB down 1.5% vs. the Stoxx 600's 0.3% advance.
    • Checking another peripheral name, Spanish 10-year yields are up 7.5 basis points to 1.50%, and the IBEX 35 is off 0.45%.
    • ETFs: EWP, EWI, HEWI, HEWP, DBSP, DBIT, FLIY
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 4 Comments

  • MBVX

    MabVax down 27% on accuracy issues in prior financials

    • Thinly traded nano cap MabVax Therapeutics Holdings (OTCPK:MBVX -26.6%) slumps on almost double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 168K shares, in apparent response to its disclosure that its financial statements for the years 2014 - 2017 can no longer be relied upon.
    • The issue apparently relates to the ownership of preferred stock and whether certain investors acted as an undisclosed group in acquiring shares.
    • The company has notified the SEC that it will be late in filing its Q1 financial statements while the matter is investigated.
    • Previously: SEC investigating MabVax related to registration statements (Jan. 30)

  • EGN

    Energen +3% as Icahn, Corvex consider making takeover offer

    • Carl Icahn and Corvex Management hedge fund, run by former Icahn Capital executive Keith Meister, declare a potential desire to buy Energen (EGN +2.9%), according to an SEC filing.
    • Meister and Icahn and Meister say EGN's shares are undervalued and may seek to join other parties in acquiring the oil and gas producer.
    • The filing also says Corvex sold 2M EGN shares to Icahn for $64.84/share and granted him an option to buy another 2M shares for $67.37/share.
    • Icahn’s affiliates could own ~4.1% of EGN, or a combined 4M shares, according to the filing; Corvex would continue to own 8.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 6 Comments
  • MYOK

    MyoKardia finalizes design of late-stage study of mavacamten in oHCM; shares down 9%

    • MyoKardia (MYOK -9%) announces the design of its Phase 3 EXPLORER-HCM study assessing mavacamten in patients with symptomatic obstructive hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (oHCM), disorder of the heart characterized impaired pumping performance caused by thickening in the ventricular walls.
    • The randomized double-blind trial will evaluate mavacamten over a 30-week treatment period in 220 subjects. The primary endpoint will be the clinical response rate versus placebo.
    • Dosing should start this quarter with topline results expected in H2 2020. Investors appear disappointed with the timeline, including the treatment period, almost twice as long as the 16-weeks used in Phase 2.
    • Mavacamten is an orally available small molecule designed to reduce left ventricular contractility by modulating the function of cardiac myosin, the protein that drives heart muscle contraction.
    • Previously: MyoKardia commences mid-stage study of mavacantem in non-obstructive HCM (April 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM

  • QURE

    UniQure's AMT-060 shows treatment benefit in hemophilia B patients with pre-existing neutralizing antibodies; shares up 3%

    • A re-analysis of pretreatment blood samples from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing uniQure's (QURE +2.7%) AAV5 gene therapy AMT-060 in hemophilia B found that patients with pre-existing anti-AAV5 neutralizing antibodies still experienced a treatment benefit. The data were presented at ASGCT in Chicago.
    • CSO Sander van Deventer, M.D., Ph.D., says, “These important data presented at ASGCT bolster our confidence that AAV5 gene therapies can provide successful liver transduction in all or nearly all patients. The study suggests that, in contrast to experience with other AAV vectors, detectable pre-existing neutralizing antibodies do not prevent successful gene transfer using AAV5 at clinical doses. In patients pre-exposed to AAV5 who tested positive for anti-AAV5 antibodies, therapeutic transgene expression was established with no cellular immune response observed after systemic administration of AAV5.”
    • The appearance of neutralizing antibodies, the immune system's response to the presence of the viral capsid (shell of a virus) used to deliver a gene therapy, potentially interferes with its effectiveness.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM

  • GLPG

    Galapagos' GLPG1690 shows positive effect in mid-stage IPF study; shares ahead 4% premarket

    • Galapagos NV (NASDAQ:GLPG) is up 4% premarket, albeit on only 452 shares, on the heels of its announcement of results from a Phase 2a clinical trial assessing autotaxin inhibitor GLPG1690 in patients with ideopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). The data were presented at the American Thoracic Society Conference in San Diego.
    • Over a 12-week treatment period, patients patients receiving once-daily GLPG1690 experienced an increase of 8 mL from baseline in a measure of lung function called forced vital capacity (FVC) which is the amount of air a person can forcefully and quickly exhale after taking a deep breath. In patients treated with placebo, FVC dropped 87 mL from baseline. Declines in FVC characterize fibrotic lung diseases.
    • GLPG1690 is about to enter Phase 3 development for the indication.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments

  • GHDX

    New data reinforce positive impact of the Oncotype DX GPS test in guiding treatment decisions

    • Genomic Health (NASDAQ:GHDX) announces results from two new studies demonstrating the positive impact of the Oncotype DX Genomic Prostate Score (GPS) test on risk assessment for better treatment decisions in low-risk prostate cancer patients.
    • An analysis performed on the first 29,000 Oncotype DX GPS tests showed that the test refined patient risk for approx. one in four men (26%). The largest shift in risk assessment in men (50%) was observed among NCCN low-risk patients. Of those who were reclassified, 35% had more favorable biology consistent with very-low risk, and 15% had less favorable with intermediate risk.
    • A prospective study of 1,200 men evaluated the impact of the GPS test on management decisions and persistence on active surveillance. One-year results demonstrated that use of the GPS test changed initial disease management for 25% of patients.
    • 63% of the GPS-tested patient selected active surveillance compared to 40% of patients who did not receive the test. 89% of men who selected active surveillance, remained on it at one year.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM

  • CDTX

    Cidara Therapeutics announces offering of common stock and warrants

    • Cidara Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CDTX) has entered into a securities purchase agreement with certain investors, in a registered direct offering, of up to $120M of its common stock, in three closings.
    • Cidara will offer 10.6M shares of common stock in the first closing at a price of $4.70 per share, for the gross proceeds of ~$50M. The first closing date is May 23.
    • In the second closing, Cidara may sell up to an additional $50M of shares of common stock to investors who purchased at least $1M of shares in the first closing (the “Major Purchasers”) at a price per share equal to 75% of the volume of the common stock for the five trading days following Cidara’s public release of STRIVE trial .
    • In an optional third closing, to be held five trading days following the second closing, purchasers who participate in the second closing may, purchase up to an additional $20M of common stock at a price per share equal to the purchase price of the shares at the second closing.
    • In a private placement concurrent with the first and third closing, Cidara is also selling warrants, at a price of $0.125 per share, to purchase 12.5M and 2.5M shares of common stock, respectively.
    • The warrants will be exercisable at a price of $6.81 per share, and will expire five years from the date of the respective closing.
    • Shares are down 1% premarket.
    • Previously: Cidara Therapeutics files Form S-3 for additional shares of common and preferred stock (May 21)
